subtitleNullable: A collection of 107730 digits in PNG format that is not from the MNIST dataset.
descriptionNullable:
### Content

A collection of 107,730 digits in 28x28 PNG format. Note that these images weren't created from the MNIST dataset. Pictures are named from 0-10772 for each digit and placed into folders named after the digit they store. The correct classification of the digit is shown before the filename, separated by '\'.

#### Example
> 0\0.png (start of zeroes in dataset)
> ...
> 0\10772.png (end of zeroes in dataset)

> 1\0.png (start of the ones in the dataset)
> ...
> 1\10772.png (end of the ones in the dataset)


### Notes & Remarks
Kaggle automatically unzipped this dataset and created an extra folder inside each digit folder (probably because of the '\' in filenames). You can download the same dataset [here](https://github.com/JC-ProgJava/Handwritten-Digit-Dataset) formatted as specified above.

### See also
Please also take a look at the [repository](https://github.com/JC-ProgJava/Handwritten-Digit-Dataset), where you can also find instructions on creating your own dataset.

### Acknowledgements

[Cover image source](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44914035/how-to-centralize-and-resize-digits-using-opencv)
